meanings.definition: Having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment.
meanings.sent1: The sagacious owl quickly spotted the hidden mouse.
meanings.sent2: She always listens to her sagacious grandmother's advice.
meanings.sent3: The sagacious squirrel decided to save some nuts for a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: His sagacious decision to invest early paid off handsomely.
meanings.sent5: The sagacious detective solved the mystery in record time.

meanings.sent1: The sagacious old man shared stories of his youth.
meanings.sent2: Her sagacious words brought comfort to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The sagacious cat always found the warmest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The sagacious tree provided shade to weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: His sagacious advice guided many through difficult times.

meanings.definition: Showing keen perception and sound judgment.
meanings.sent1: The sagacious teacher knew how to engage her students.
meanings.sent2: His sagacious leadership steered the company to success.
meanings.sent3: The sagacious dog always knew when it was dinnertime.
meanings.sent4: The sagacious mountain climber chose the safest route.
meanings.sent5: Her sagacious choice of colors made the painting come alive.
